Sentencas: A solid-state technique was used to synthesize ceria-based (CDC-xT, in which x=0-1 mol%) solid electrolyte ceramics.
Titulo: Effect of titania concentration on the grain boundary conductivity of calcium-doped ceria electrolyte

Sentencas: The effects of doping the ceramic solid electrolyte (CDC) with titanium oxide were studied with regard to densification, crystal structure, morphology, electro-impedance spectroscopy and fuel cell performance.
Titulo: Effect of titania concentration on the grain boundary conductivity of calcium-doped ceria electrolyte

Sentencas: TiO2 doping afforded materials a 95% relative density at 940 degrees C, approximately 200 degrees C lower than the temperature required without titanium oxide.
Titulo: Effect of titania concentration on the grain boundary conductivity of calcium-doped ceria electrolyte

Sentencas: The addition of titanium oxide (TiO2) reduced the CDC sintering temperature and significantly improved the grain boundary conduction.
Titulo: Effect of titania concentration on the grain boundary conductivity of calcium-doped ceria electrolyte

Sentencas: The minimum grain boundary resistivity was obtained at 0.8 mol% TiO2.
Titulo: Effect of titania concentration on the grain boundary conductivity of calcium-doped ceria electrolyte

Sentencas: X-ray diffraction (XRD) results showed that the lattice parameters enhanced with increased titanium oxide concentrations up to 0.8 mol%, revealing the solubility limit for Caria's fluorite structure.
Titulo: Effect of titania concentration on the grain boundary conductivity of calcium-doped ceria electrolyte

Sentencas: The optimum doping level (0.8 mol%) is provided maximum conductivity.
Titulo: Effect of titania concentration on the grain boundary conductivity of calcium-doped ceria electrolyte

Sentencas: Conductivities were measured using EIS (Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy) with a two-probe method, and the activation energies were calculated using the Arrhenius plots.
Titulo: Effect of titania concentration on the grain boundary conductivity of calcium-doped ceria electrolyte

Sentencas: The maximum power density (660 mW/cm(2)) was achieved with CDC 0.8T electrolyte at 650 degrees C using LiCuZnNi oxide electrodes.
Titulo: Effect of titania concentration on the grain boundary conductivity of calcium-doped ceria electrolyte
